conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during deceleration.
Particle A deceleration phase: starts at t = t0, ends at t = 3t0. Particle B deceleration phase: starts at t = 5t0, ends at t = 6t0.
Particle A initial velocity at t = t0 is 2v0, final velocity at t = 3t0 is v0.
Change in velocity for Particle A: Δv_A = v0 - 2v0 = -v0.
Particle B initial velocity at t = 5t0 is v0, final velocity at t = 6t0 is 0.
Change in velocity for Particle B: Δv_B = 0 - v0 = -v0.
Time interval for Particle A deceleration: Δt_A = 3t0 - t0 = 2t0.
Time interval for Particle B deceleration: Δt_B = 6t0 - 5t0 = t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle A: a_A = -v0 / 2t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle B: a_B = -v0 / t0.
Magnitude of a_A = v0 / 2t0, Magnitude of a_B = v0 / t0.
Final answer: The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B during their deceleration phases is 1/2.
